solution.text:
Percentage of people who play football= \(\frac{Ratio\, of\, people\, who\, play\, football}{total\, ratio} \times 100\).
Percentage of people who play football =\( \frac{Ratio\, of\, football \, players}{Ratio \,of\, cricket\, players + ratio\, of\, basketball\, players + ratio \,of\, football \, players}\times 100\)
Hence, Percentage = \( \frac{_{j}_}{(4 + _{{16-j}}_+_{j}_)} \times 100\)
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore the percentage of football players = _{{j*5}}_ %

content.text: The percentage of people who play football, if the ratio of people who play cricket to people who play football to people who play basketball is 4:_{j}_:_{{16-j}}_.
